card.name: Blood Knight
card.ruling: 2/1/2007: This is the timeshifted version of Black Knight.

card.name: Bramblewood Paragon
card.ability:
Each other Warrior creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008: If a Warrior would normally enter the battlefield with a certain number of +1/+1 counters on it, it enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters plus one on it instead. If a Warrior would normally enter the battlefield with no +1/+1 counters on it, it enters the battlefield with one +1/+1 counter on it instead.

4/1/2008: The creature gets the counter if it would enter the battlefield under your control. It doesn't matter who owns the creature or what zone it enters the battlefield from (such as your opponent's graveyard, for example).

4/1/2008: The creature gets the counter if its copiable characteristics as it would exist on the battlefield include the specified creature type. For example, say you control Conspiracy, and the chosen creature type is Warrior. If you put a creature onto the battlefield that isn't normally a Warrior, it won't get a counter from Bramblewood Paragon.

4/1/2008: The effects from more than one Bramblewood Paragon are cumulative. That is, if you have more than one Bramblewood Paragon on the battlefield, Warrior creatures you control enter the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on them.

4/1/2008: If Bramblewood Paragon enters the battlefield at the same time as another Warrior (due to Living End, for example), that creature doesn't get a +1/+1 counter.

card.name: Doran, the Siege Tower
card.ability: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007: Doran's ability means, for example, that a 2/3 creature will assign 3 damage in combat instead of 2.

10/1/2007: Doran's ability doesn't actually change creatures' power; it changes only the value of the combat damage they assign. All other rules and effects that check power or toughness use the real values.

10/1/2007: This effect is mandatory and affects all creatures.

card.name: Electrolyze
card.ability:
Electrolyze deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
Draw a card.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006: If only one target is chosen, then Electrolyze is a spell with a single target and subject to effects like Ink-Treader Nephilim's and Shunt's.

card.name: Groundbreaker
card.ability:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Groundbreaker.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007: This is the timeshifted version of Ball Lightning.

2/1/2007: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

card.name: Imperious Perfect
card.ability:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Mutavault
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mutavault becomes a 2/2 creature with all creature types until end of turn. It's still a land.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008: Although Mutavault has all creature types while it's animated, it does not have the changeling keyword ability.

8/1/2008: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Draw a card.

card.name: Rakdos Guildmage
card.ability:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
{3}{B}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{3}{R}: Put a 2/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006: If the second ability is activated during the End step, the token won't be exiled until the following turn's End step.

card.name: Serra Avenger
card.ability:
You can't cast Serra Avenger during your first, second, or third turns of the game.
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.ruling:
9/25/2006: You can cast Serra Avenger during another player's first, second, or third turns of the game if some other effect (such as Vedalken Orrery) enables that.

7/1/2012: Serra Avenger cares about how many turns you have taken, not necessarily how many turns the game has had, in case you take an extra turn.

7/1/2012: If the game is restarted (by Karn Liberated), you can't cast Serra Avenger in your first, second, or third turn in the new game.

card.name: Urza's Factory
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{7}, {T}: Put a 2/2 colorless Assembly-Worker artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 9/25/2006: Although Urza's Factory has the Urza's land type, it doesn't interact with Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, or Urza's Power Plant.

card.name: Voidslime
card.ability: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
